paper.title: Semantically Guided First-Order Theorem Proving using Hyper-Linking
paper.abstract: An automated theorem prover accepts a set of axioms and a theorem, expressed in a formal logic, and then proves that the theorem logically follows from the axioms. Two basic aspects of a logic are syntax and semantics. Syntax refers to the form of the statements and semantics refers to their meanings. Most current theorem provers conduct proof searching based on syntax only and semantics is rarely :[67],"this dissertation we propose a new and complete theorem proving method, called semantic hyper-linking, which makes a substantial use of semantics in an instance-based theorem prover for first-order logic. Semantics is used to generate instances by a combination of unification and enumeration of the Herbrand base.
